title: Romance novel fonts search
content:
I'm working on a design project that calls for those fantasy style fonts used on Romance novel covers. Anything from the cheesy to elegant is appropriate. Anyone know of a font (free would be better given my time constraint) out there. So far the only thing I can find handy is Edwardian Script.

Here's an example of what I'm looking for:

Thanks in advance,  
-Kris

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140524114507im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Romance_6699.JPG)
author: kris dale

comments.content: [Paperback](http://web.archive.org/web/20140524114507/http:/houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=171&subpage=viewfonts)! You can download it right away, so it doesn’t take a long time to get.
You could also try Adobe Pro fonts with swashes… Caslon, Garamond, Minion, even Warnock.

Well, the face used in your example is a modified [Monotype Corsiva](http://web.archive.org/web/20140524114507/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/agfa/monotype-corsiva/). Similar faces include [Zapf Chancery](http://web.archive.org/web/20140524114507/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-zapf-chancery/) and [Medici Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20140524114507/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/medici-script/).

None are free, but they are all reasonably priced.

Thanks for the quick turnaround. I didn't have access to my Caslon swashes at home. I went with Monotype Corsiva. I had it pre-selected as one of my choices. Paperback is pretty nice. I'll be looking to use it sometime in the future.

Here's what I came up with on the fly (1 hour):

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140524114507im_/http:/typophile.com/files/07dtill2_4270.jpg)
Don't do it! Swash caps were not meant to be used in all caps settings!!!
